TITLE: U.S. Job Growth Slowed in August
SUMMARY: The monthly employment report suggested that the Federal Reserve might be able to tame inflation without causing a recession.

TITLE: On Truth Social, Trump Embraces Far-Right Conspiracy Theories
SUMMARY: The former president’s activity on his social network, Truth Social, openly promotes far-right and conspiratorial ideas that are usually confined to corners of the internet.

TITLE: AI-Generated Art Won a Prize. Artists Aren’t Happy.
SUMMARY: “I won, and I didn’t break any rules,” the artwork’s creator says.

TITLE: Trying to Sell Your Old Peloton Bike? So Is Peloton.
SUMMARY: As its business slumps, Peloton is trying something new: selling its bikes to “value-minded” customers. It faces stiff competition.

TITLE: Russia Says the Gas Pipeline to Germany Will Remain Closed
SUMMARY: Nord Stream 1, operated by state-owned Gazprom, won’t reopen Saturday as expected, heightening fears Russia will step up its use of energy to pressure Europe.

TITLE: Price Cap on Russian Oil Wins Backing of G7 Ministers
SUMMARY: The proposal aims to stabilize unsettled energy markets in the wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. But it faces considerable obstacles.

TITLE: The Flaw in Biden’s Pro-Labor Record: Uber Drivers Are Still Waiting for Help
SUMMARY: The administration’s plans to strengthen their labor protections have been slowed by Congress, the courts and a lobbying blitz.

TITLE: Strikes Sweep the U.K. as Workers Demand Better Pay
SUMMARY: Backed by unions and tired of years of low wage growth, workers are making bold pay demands to cope with the rising cost of living. Some say this is just the beginning.

TITLE: Line of UPPAbaby Strollers Recalled After Child’s Fingertip Amputated
SUMMARY: Only one case has been reported involving an UPPAbaby All-Terrain RIDGE Jogging Stroller, the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission said.

TITLE: Pete Buttigieg Is Trying to Fix Air Travel With a ‘Dashboard.’ What’s on It?
SUMMARY: The D.O.T. says its new interactive chart is compelling many U.S. airlines to publicly commit to pay for things like hotels and meals when flights are canceled or significantly delayed. But does it have teeth?

TITLE: California Biotech Executive Is Guilty in $77 Million Blood-Testing Scheme
SUMMARY: Arrayit Corporation claimed to have invented a technology to test for any disease using a drop of blood, including Covid-19 and cancer.

TITLE: Parler Returns to Google Play Store
SUMMARY: Google said that Parler had more robust content moderation practices than it did when it was banned in the aftermath of the Jan. 6 riot.

TITLE: Investigators Seize 27 Antiquities From the Met, Citing Looting
SUMMARY: The museum said it is cooperating with the Manhattan district attorney’s office, which has executed several search warrants at the museum since February.

TITLE: Kazuo Inamori, Major Industrialist in Postwar Japan, Dies at 90
SUMMARY: Founding two giant companies, he helped turn his country into an economic giant while encouraging employees to approach work with an almost spiritual devotion.

TITLE: Barbara Ehrenreich, Explorer of Prosperity’s Dark Side, Dies at 81
SUMMARY: Her book “Nickel and Dimed,” an undercover account of the indignities of being a low-wage worker in the United States, is considered a classic in social justice literature.

TITLE: Join Al Gore and John Kerry for a Times Climate Event
SUMMARY: How does climate change exacerbate other global challenges? Join us remotely or in person for our climate event series, with an upcoming gathering in New York in September.

TITLE: The Jobs Report Could Be Seen as Good News for Biden
SUMMARY: Slowing job growth and rising worker participation follow the president’s road map for economic transition

TITLE: Starbucks Named Laxman Narasimhan Its New C.E.O.
SUMMARY: Laxman Narasimhan most recently led Reckitt Benckiser, where he was tasked with turning around the consumer products conglomerate.

TITLE: Fed Officials May Be Encouraged by the Latest Labor Data
SUMMARY: Policymakers are looking for signs that interest rate increases are cooling off the labor market, affecting wages, purchases and ultimately prices.

TITLE: A Flight Attendant Answers Your Burning Travel and Etiquette Questions
SUMMARY: Where is the best seat if you’re airsick prone? Why don’t flight crews eat the same meals? And the age-old question: Can middle-seat passengers really claim both armrests?

TITLE: Chairman of Russia’s Lukoil, Ravil Maganov, Dies Under Murky Circumstances
SUMMARY: The chairman of Lukoil, Russia’s second-largest oil company, fell to his death from a sixth-floor hospital window in Moscow.

TITLE: In California’s Housing Fight, It’s Newsom vs. NIMBY
SUMMARY: Laws to encourage more development and denser housing don’t do much good if no one enforces them. As the state political calculus shifts, Gavin Newsom is trying to change that.

TITLE: Labor Board Official Says Amazon Effort to Overturn Staten Island Warehouse Election Should Be Rejected
SUMMARY: The labor official concluded that Amazon’s objections to the election should be set aside and that the Amazon Labor Union should be certified to represent workers at the warehouse.

TITLE: Starbucks Names Laxman Narasimhan as Its New C.E.O.
SUMMARY: Laxman Narasimhan, who will take over for Howard Schultz in April, will lead the company at a time of a growing unionization movement and rising costs.

TITLE: Amid Heat Wave, California Asks Electric Vehicle Owners to Limit Charging
SUMMARY: Critics of the state’s push to end reliance on gas-powered vehicles seized on the news. But environmentalists said the extreme weather underscored the need for the E.V. transition.

TITLE: A Solar Firm Plans to Build Off-Grid Neighborhoods in California
SUMMARY: Sunnova Energy is seeking permission from state regulators to develop microgrids for new housing developments that would not be reliant on established electric utilities.

TITLE: Biden’s Student Loan Plan Could Face a Protracted Legal Fight
SUMMARY: The White House’s use of emergency powers to enact widespread debt relief could be ripe for challenges.

TITLE: Stocks on Wall Street end higher, breaking their losing streak.
SUMMARY: The pullback preceded the U.S. government’s latest update on the state of the job market on Friday.

TITLE: Germany Announces New LNG Facility, a Move Away From Russian Energy
SUMMARY: The government said much of the infrastructure under construction to supply L.N.G. could be reused to import hydrogen, which Europe is backing as an important clean fuel of the future.

TITLE: Does This Fisherman Have the Right to Be in a Billionaire’s Backyard?
SUMMARY: A fight along Colorado’s waterways pits an alliance of white-water rafters and amateur anglers against some of the nation’s wealthiest landowners, bruising the image of a sportsman’s paradise.

TITLE: Spain Offers Free Train Tickets Through End of Year
SUMMARY: Rail passengers will be able to take free train journeys under 300 kilometers (186 miles) until the end of the year.

TITLE: Bank of America Tests No-Down-Payment Mortgages in Black and Hispanic Neighborhoods
SUMMARY: The pilot program aims to help first-time buyers in several neighborhoods obtain affordable loans.

TITLE: Abortion Rights Loom Larger in Investment Decisions
SUMMARY: After the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, Alinea, an investing app geared toward young adults, saw a new focus on companies that support reproductive health.

TITLE: Twitter Unveils an Edit Button, Finally
SUMMARY: Finally.

TITLE: Architects at a New York Firm Form the Industry’s Only Private-Sector Union
SUMMARY: Workers at Bernheimer Architecture said they hoped to prompt changes to industrywide problems like long hours and low pay.

TITLE: Big Tech Reconsiders the “Made in China” Way
SUMMARY: Apple, Google and Microsoft are among the technology firms looking to shift some of their manufacturing out of China.

TITLE: Portugal Could Hold an Answer for a Europe Captive to Russian Gas
SUMMARY: Long cut off from the continent’s grid, Portugal and Spain built a system based on imports and alternatives like solar that is the envy of fellow European Union nations.

TITLE: Tech Companies Slowly Shift Production Away From China
SUMMARY: Worried about geopolitical tensions and stung by pandemic shutdowns, Google, Apple and others are moving some work to nearby countries.

TITLE: An Apple Watch for Your 5-Year-Old? More Parents Say Yes.
SUMMARY: As Apple prepares to unveil new models next week, the smart watch has found an unexpected audience: children as young as 5.

TITLE: Things to Do in Seattle: Art Museums, Restaurants and More
SUMMARY: The pandemic may have left some gaps in the urban fabric, but a neighborhood-by-neighborhood rundown of new restaurants and art events reveals that recovery is well underway.

TITLE: Debt-Stricken Sri Lanka Reaches Initial Deal for I.M.F. Bailout
SUMMARY: The package includes nearly $3 billion in loans for an island nation that ousted its president amid a devastating economic crisis.

TITLE: U.S. Restricts Sales of Sophisticated Chips to China and Russia
SUMMARY: Limits were placed on high-end GPUs that power supercomputers and artificial intelligence, said Nvidia and AMD, two Silicon Valley chip makers.

TITLE: Disney Considers a Membership Plan to Leverage Its Empire for Disney+
SUMMARY: Seeking to fulfill a promise to make Disney+ profitable by 2024, the company is weighing stepping up its efforts to cross-sell its offerings.

TITLE: ‘Publishing Error’ Delays Dinesh D’Souza’s Book ’2000 Mules’
SUMMARY: The publication date was postponed by almost two months, until Oct. 25.

TITLE: Toyota Adds $2.5 Billion to Its Investment in a North Carolina Battery Plant
SUMMARY: The plan is part of a global push by the automaker to develop and produce electric vehicles.

TITLE: Snap Lays Off 20% of Employees and Restructures
SUMMARY: The maker of Snapchat discontinued some of its products and appointed a chief operating officer, amid financial struggles.

TITLE: Bed Bath & Beyond Tries to Turn Itself Around, Again
SUMMARY: The beleaguered retailer’s latest rescue plan embraces a “back-to-basics philosophy,” its chief said, an effort to reverse falling sales, negative cash flow and supply chain woes.

TITLE: Eurozone Inflation Sets the Stage for Another Big Rate Increase
SUMMARY: The European Central Bank, when it meets next week, is expected to raise interest rates again to curb eurozone inflation, which just set a record.

TITLE: Bed Bath & Beyond Secures a Financial Lifeline
SUMMARY: The retailer confirmed that it has taken out more than $500 million in new financing as it seeks to shore up its struggling business.

TITLE: Inflation Tightens Its Grip on Europe
SUMMARY: Price rises in the eurozone hit another record in August, with Estonia reaching 25 percent and eight other countries registering double-digit annual inflation.

TITLE: Legacy Black-Owned Businesses Get a Reboot
SUMMARY: Brands like Fashion Fair and Madam, founded with the goal of serving Black communities, faded at the end of the last century. Now, they’re being revived with similar missions in mind.

TITLE: Why Totino’s Needs 25 Ways to Make Pizza Rolls
SUMMARY: As supply chain delays and rising costs made individual ingredients harder to procure, food companies had to become very flexible.

TITLE: Silicon Valley Discovers an Age-Old Child Care Hack: The Neighbors
SUMMARY: Otter, a new child care platform, is attracting millions of dollars in venture capital. But can it fix a broken industry?

TITLE: Some Carmakers Say Recycling Car Parts Is the Future. But Is It Realistic?
SUMMARY: “Circular manufacturing” has the promise to reduce waste by reusing parts to make new cars. There are glimmers of hope, but they are currently outweighed by challenges.

TITLE: Russia Halts Natural Gas Flows to Germany Again
SUMMARY: Gazprom said the Nord Stream 1 pipeline would undergo three days of maintenance, raising worries about a complete shutdown of Russian gas deliveries to Germany.

TITLE: Job Openings Picked Up in July, Showing the Labor Market Remains Hot
SUMMARY: Even with the Fed raising interest rates, employers are still eager to hire.

TITLE: Paxlovid Cuts Covid Deaths Among Older People, Israeli Study Finds
SUMMARY: Among patients under 65, however, the drug made little difference in hospitalization or death rates.

TITLE: French Tax Collectors Use A.I. to Spot Thousands of Undeclared Pools
SUMMARY: Algorithms combing through satellite photos found over 20,000 unreported swimming pools in a few regions, yielding an expected $10 million in taxes, and the system will soon go nationwide.

TITLE: First Solar says it will spend up to $1.2 billion to expand U.S. production.
SUMMARY: The solar panel maker will build a factory in the Southeast and expand three Ohio plants, creating nearly 1,000 jobs.
